description.short: One of Britain's most iconic mountain biking destinations, featuring over 100km of all-weather singletrack trails set in the stunning Afan Valley, South Wales.
description.full:
Afan Forest Park is one of the world's most established mountain biking destinations, boasting more all-weather singletrack than any other mountain biking centre in Wales. Located in the heart of the Afan Valley, this former coal mining valley has been transformed into a trail riding paradise, offering six superb flowing trails ranging from 7km to over 40km, plus an extreme-graded bike park at Gyfylchi.

The trails cater to all abilities, from the green-graded Rookie trail and skills park perfect for beginners, through the blue-graded Blue Scar for developing riders, to the renowned red-graded Penhydd, Y Wal (The Wall), White's Level and Blade trails. For those seeking the ultimate challenge, the black-graded W2 trail linking Y Wal and White's Level features some of the most demanding descents and technical singletrack sections in the UK. The gentle Rheilfordd Trail follows the valley floor along an old railway line, perfect for families.

The Afan Forest Park Visitor Centre serves as the main hub, offering bike hire, repairs, showers, bike wash, and the Base Wales café. The South Wales Miners' Museum within the visitor centre tells the story of the valley's industrial heritage. With stunning scenery, world-class trails maintained by dedicated volunteers, and excellent facilities, Afan Forest Park delivers an unforgettable mountain biking experience where traces of industrial history have been gently reclaimed by nature.

openingTimes.note: Car park and visitor centre managed by Neath Port Talbot Council. Trail conditions may vary - check Natural Resources Wales updates.

pricing.showerNote: Cash only - tokens from visitor centre

trails.name: Rookie Trail & Skills Park
trails.description: Perfect introductory route for newcomers with optional 2.4km blue loop

trails.name: Rheilfordd Cycle Trail
trails.description: Gentle trail following old railway track through the valley

trails.name: Blue Scar Trail
trails.description: Progression trail for riders competent on green routes

trails.name: Penhydd
trails.description: Classic South Wales trail mixing forest road climbs with flowing singletrack

trails.name: Y Wal (The Wall)
trails.description: Some of the best singletrack descents in the UK

trails.name: W2 Trail
trails.description: Links Y Wal and White's Level - 42km challenging combined ride

testimonials.quote: Good choice of bike trails, cheap car parking, food available & toilets on site.
Great trails for all levels, good parking and visitor centre/cafe.
Lovely place to walk, run or mountain bike.
What a beautiful place with stunning views! Afan Forest has loads of walking trails and several mountain bike trails.
testimonials.author: Bob JOE

accessibility.note: Suitable for adaptive cycles, adaptive wheelchairs and mobility scooters

bookingNote: No booking required for trails. Bike hire available on site.

alternativeStartPoints.name: Glyncorrwg Mountain Bike Centre
alternativeStartPoints.address: Ynyscorrwg Park, Glyncorrwg, Port Talbot, SA13 3EA

gettingThere.byRoad: Leave M4 at J40, follow brown signage along A4107 for Afan Forest Park. Approximately 6 miles from motorway.
gettingThere.byTrain: Port Talbot Parkway Railway Station on main line from London Paddington
gettingThere.byBus: Bus stops at Pontrhydyfen/Oakwood, Afan Forest Park Visitor Centre, Cymmer and Glyncorrwg
gettingThere.byBike: Sustrans Cycle Route 887 from Aberavon Seafront

researchMetadata.notes: TripAdvisor blocked access. No direct email address published - contact via form only. Phone number confirmed via Google Maps listing. Managed jointly by Natural Resources Wales (trails) and Neath Port Talbot Council (visitor centre/parking).
